title: Is narcissism the only disorder that causes unstable self-esteem? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, not at all. Narcissistic Personality Disorder (NPD) causes self esteem that is entirely dependent upon the admiration & validation of others. If they receive that admiration & validation, they feel superior. If they DON’T receive it, or are criticized, they feel utterly WORTHLESS inside. Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD) may either cause vacillating self esteem (that shifts rapidly from self-confident to extreme insecurity/self-loathing) or very low self esteem. They also tend feel a profound sense of inner emptiness and like they have a void inside. Histrionic Personality Disorder (HPD) causes self esteem that is dependent on the notice & attention others provide, and intense feelings of invisibility & non-existence if they don’t receive attention. Obsessive Compulsive Personality Disorder (OCPD) causes self esteem that is entirely based on external accomplishments, and they spiral into self loathing if they view themselves as having “failed.” Dependent Personality Disorder (DPD) causes self esteem that is based entirely upon their attachment figure’s approval of them. If rejected or disapproved of by their attachment figure, they mentally spiral. Codependency causes self esteem that is based entirely on their ability to save/rescue/”fix” dysfunctional people. They tend to have demolished self esteem and feel their only worth is their ability to fix/rescue/save people, and this is often the only thing they do which they feel has value. Schizophrenia can cause self esteem that shifts depending on what any voices they hear are saying at the moment & depending on their current beliefs which society would deem delusional. Schizoaffective Disorder (Bipolar Type) causes self esteem that may be extremely high (in mania or hypomania) or extremely low (in depressive episodes) depending on the current mood episode. ADD/ADHD may cause self esteem that plummets the instant they learn they screwed up again on an attention/memory required task. Bipolar Spectrum Disorder (inc. Bipolar I, Bipolar II, & Cyclothymic Disorder) causes self esteem that may be extremely high (in mania or hypomania) or extremely low (in depressive episodes) depending on the current mood episode. Mixed Depression (where someone experiences BOTH mania & depressive symptoms AT THE SAME TIME) can cause HIGHLY unstable, shifting self esteem. Dissociative Identity Disorder (DID) can cause the body as a whole to have very unstable self esteem because some alters may be confident & self assured and others may be self-loathing. CPTSD, Avoidant Personality Disorder, & Self Defeating Personality Disorder (unofficial) cause stable utterly demolished self esteem, as opposed to unstable self esteem. Schizoaffective Disorder (Depressive Type), Major Depressive Disorder, Dysthymia, Generalized Anxiety Disorder, Social Anxiety Disorder, Standard PTSD, Reactive Attachment Disorder, Disinhibited Social Engagement Disorder, Anorexia Nervosa, & Bulimia Nervosa also cause persistent low self esteem.

Their self-esteem is high, too high. When they don't get the adoration and attention they think they deserve they get resentful, jealous, angry, spiteful. Their self-esteem is stable, all consuming. A black hole of me me me.
